subject: Re: JUnit Testing
msgSnippet: ... There are a handful of books out now that would help, including mine (TDD: A Practical Guide), Johannes Link s (Unit Testing in Java), Rick Hightower s
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "vinod_c_in" <vinod_c_in@y...> wrote:
> Hello experts,
> I am new to JUnit and need some help in using Junit.

There are a handful of books out now that would help, including mine
(TDD: A Practical Guide), Johannes Link's (Unit Testing in Java), Rick
Hightower's (Java Tools for Extreme Programming), and the new O'Reilly
one (Java Extreme Programming Cookbook).

> I need to test the following condition with junit.

In my opinion you should be testing ALL your "conditions" :) In fact
you should be writting the tests first.

> I have a class with one method

Why is it justified being a separate class.

> which gets vector from another class
> and its then does some calculation based on the data in vector.

Why doesn't the class with the Vector do the calculation?

> How do I test this with junit.

You've provided nowhere enough information.

Basically. Think about what it has to do in different situations....
write that down in the tests. Think:
- What has to be true after it does that? make that an assertion.
- How do I make it do that? put that call before the assertion.
- What needs to be in place so that it can do that? that's your fixture.

Dave
